did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: FBI Files on Highlander Folk School on Microfilm, 1940-1972
did.physdesc: Articles, reports, pamphlets, correspondence, news clippings, records, publications, microfilm.
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Highlander Folk School (HFS) in Monteagle, Tennessee, was established in 1932 by Myles Horton, a native Tennessean, who wanted to "provide an educational center in the South for the training of rural and industrial leaders, and for the conservation and enrichment of the indigenous cultural values of the mountain." The school accepted workers whom their unions considered potential leaders, and the unions paid most of their way through the school. These workers were trained in such endeavors as collective bargaining, contract negotiation, and strike organization, as well as less weighty, but presumably no less important, skills like poster-making and song-singing. Rosa Parks was trained by Highlander prior to her historic role in the Montgomery Bus Boycott, other activists who participated in training include members of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC), Septima Clark, Anne Braden, Martin Luther King, Jr., James Bevel, Hollis Watkins, Bernard Lafayette, Ralph Abernathy and John Lewis in the mid - and - late 1950s. The state of Tennessee closed the school in 1961 because of backlash against the school's involvement with the Civil Rights Movement.
Highlander reorganized and moved to Knoxville, Tennessee, where it reopened as the Highlander Research and Education Center.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: FBI Files on Highlander Folk School on Microfilm #5898 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

5717: Highlander Folk School Publications

scopecontent.p: 1/29/40 on speech by James Dombrowski, chairman of the Highlander Folk School (HFS), on the philosophy and program of the school, including a list of HFS Advisory Committee members
spring 1940
alleging Communist influence within the HFS
12/6/40 to Bureau Director J. Edgar Hoover regarding request from Congressman Robert F. Jones to review the HFS file
4/9/41 from the special agent-in-charge (SAC), Knoxville, to Hoover requesting the bureau to develop photographs of HFS documents
4/14/41 from SAC Knoxville regarding report on the HFS furnished to William Green, president of the American Federation of Labor
5/13/41 on the enrollment of William T. Buttrick, Jr., at the University of Florida
6/1/41 regarding past activities of HFS faculty members
6/4/41 on Edwin B. Schutlz
6/6/41 from R.C. Hendon to Clyde Tolson regarding the HFS
6/41 concerning background checks of HFS personnel
7/29/41 concerning background checks
7/17/41 including the HFS Charter of Incorporation
9/29/41 concerning the Institute for Labor Studies
10/4/41 from W.A. Murphy (SAC Knoxville) to Hoover concerning Myles Horton
10/12/41 from Murphy to Hoover regarding status of the HFS investigation
10/21/41 concerning HFS contributors
11/29/41 on HFS personnel
12/30/41 on all aspects of the HFS to date
1/8/42 regarding Joseph Kelley Stockton
1/19/42 from Murphy to Hoover stating that HFS-produced publications, including The Highlander Fling, will be provided in future reports
1/28/42 from Murphy to Hoover regarding a synopsis of the HFS 1941 annual report
2/16/42 from Murphy to Hoover, including copies of The Highlander Fling
2/26/42 on James Dombrowski
2/28/42 from Murphy to Hoover regarding a $100 donation to the HFS from Eleanor Roosevelt

did.unittitle: Copy of the ninth annual report of the HFS
Copy of Songs of Field and Factory

scopecontent.p: HFS publication, spring 1940
3/18/42 from Murphy to Hoover, including HFS promotional literature and additional copies of The Highlander Fling
4/1/42 on interview of Horton concerning his activities in the school area
6/17/42 concerning interview of a former HFS employee
7/9/42 regarding the HFS benefit concert in Washington by Paul Robeson and other HFS activities

did.unittitle: includes newspaper clippings and additional HFS publications

scopecontent.p: 9/12/42 regarding founding of the HFS and other background information
10/23/42 from Hoover to SAC Knoxville ordering a halt to the active investigation of the HFS
10/22/42 on summer session of the HFS
10/27/42 from K.R. McIntire to Mr. Mumford, including HFS promotional materials
12/3/42 on tenth anniversary activities at the HFS
12/14/42 regarding closing of file, including one HFS publication
2/14/47 from Assistant Attorney General David L. Bagelon to Hoover regrading the HFS
3/18/48 from Hoover to SAC Knoxville regarding possible Communist "front" status of the HFS
12/10/50 from Myles Horton to Hugh H. Clegg, assistant director of the bureau
1/4/51 from D.M. Ladd to Hoover regarding response to Horton
1/22/51 from Mr. Belmont to Mr. Ladd regarding response to Horton
2/14/51 from the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) to Hoover inquiring into the investigation of the HFS
1/31/51 from Horton to US Attorney General J. Howard McGrath regarding bureau investigation of black students enrolled at the HFS
2/26/51 from Hoover to Peyton Ford, deputy attorney general, concerning correspondence with Myles Horton
2/21/51 from D.M. Ladd to the director regarding Baldwin's allegation of bureau activity at the HFS
2/21/51 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding interviews of Myles Horton
3/5/51 from Peyton Ford to Hoover regarding correspondence with Myles Horton
3/12/51 from L.L. Laughlin to A.H. Belmont regarding an HFS letter alleging bureau investigation of interracial enrollment
2/27/51 from D.M. Ladd to Hoover regarding complaints surrounding the HFS investigation
3/14/51 from Lucy R. Mason of the Congress of Industrial Organizations regarding bureau agents
2/23/51 from D.M. Ladd to Hoover regarding the investigation of the HFS
4/18/51 from Herbert M. Levy of the ACLU regarding correspondence from Hoover
8/25/53 from A.H. Belmont to D.M. Ladd regarding Jenner Committee request for information on Myles Horton
8/27/53 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding interview of Rev. W.A. Swift, Monteagle, TN
4/27/56 regarding Myles Horton and his wife

did.unittitle: Copy of the HFS 21st Annual Report (10/1/52-9/30/53)
Copy of "A Guide to Community Action for Public School Integration"

scopecontent.p: 9/20/56 from SAC Mobile to Hoover regarding the HFS
8/30/57 from L.B. Nichols to Clyde Tolson regarding increased activity at the HFS and the plan of events for its 25th anniversary
9/4/57 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding information that the HFS is becoming a center for teaching civil disobedience

did.unittitle: Pamphlet issued by the Georgia Commission on Education, Governor Marvin Griffin, chairman, alleging Communist activities at the HFS

scopecontent.p: 11/1/57 from Hoover to SAC Knoxville inquiring into civil disobedience activities at the HFS
11/21/57 from Septima Clark of the HFS soliciting funds

did.unittitle: Copy of "Official Statement of Policy" of the HFS
Pamphlet: "Communism and the NAACP," origin unknown

scopecontent.p: 1/59 from Myles Horton soliciting funds
2/2/59 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding action by Tennessee legislature to investigate "subversive" activities at the HFS
2/24/59 from SAC Memphis to Hoover regarding support of Tennessee legislature by the Tennessee Federation for Constitutional Government
6/8/59 to C.D. DeLoach regarding John's Island Branch of the HFS

did.unittitle: Newspaper clippings regarding police raid on the HFS

scopecontent.p: 9/11/59 from Hoover to SAC Knoxville regarding open protest letter from Myles Horton
9/15/59 on the HFS
2/29/60 from SAC Louisville to Hoover regarding the "Friends of Highlander"

did.unittitle: Newspaper clippings regarding revocation of the HFS charter

scopecontent.p: 5/22/61 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover pertaining to latest legal actions and decision
6/29/61 from Hoover to legal attache, Bonn (Federal Republic of Germany), regarding furnishing information about the HFS outisde the bureau
10/17/61 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding contingency plans for the HFS to move to Knoxville
10/25/61 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding prointegration activities at the HFS
6/20/63 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding information about racial matters
7/18/63 from R.W. Smith to W.C. Sullivan regarding requests from Senator Warren G. Magnuson and Congressman Jeffery Cohilan concerning racial agitation
7/26/63 from F.J. Baumgardner to W.C. Sullivan regarding Highlander Research and Education Center (HREC), Knoxville, and request for list of officers, teachers, and students
8/13/64 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding update on situation
7/7/64 from SAC Knoxville regarding the Washington Committee for the HFS
8/28/64 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding voter registration drive at the Sea Island Progressive Club Center, St. John's Island, SC
9/10/64 from SAC Savannah to Hoover regarding the HREC
7/27/64 from M.A. Jones to C.D. DeLoach regarding request by Congressman Roman C. Purinski for information about the HFS
4/6/65 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover concerning information on student march on Washington, co-sponsored by the HREC
10/19/65 from SAC Louisville to Hoover regarding vandalism against the HREC
10/19/65 from Hoover to chief, US Secret Service, regarding the HREC
4/13/67 from SAC Louisville to Hoover regarding vote by the Tennessee House of Representatives to start a second legislative investigation of the HREC

did.unittitle: Copy of Tennessee House Joint Resolution No. 14

scopecontent.p: authorizing a committee to investigate the activites of the HREC of Knoxville County and its affiliated organizations
6/9/67 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding the HREC

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous letters to the bureau requesting information about the HFS and the HREC

scopecontent.p: 1/20/1958 from SAC Knoxville to director regarding attempt to blow up the HFS
3/16/59 from SAC Memphis to Hoover regarding bomb threat received at the HFS
9/6/63 from SAC Knoxville to Hoover regarding bomb threat received at the HREC
